div.p: APPROACH so as to BECOME:come to be IN A CERTAIN PLACE.
1. The current general word for reaching a place or even an abstract stage is jí 及.
2. Dào 到 is concrete and typically refers to reaching a point in space.
3. Bǐ jí 比及 refers to reaching a point in time.
4. Dài 逮 refers to catching up or reaching a certain desirable stage or level of achievement. See also CATCH UP.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: A Dictionary of Selected Synonyms in the Principal Indo-European Languages
古漢語常用詞同義詞詞典

entry.def: Dào 到 is concrete and typically refers to reaching a point in space.

sense.def: reach as far as (not by walking), lead to

entry.def: The current general word for reaching a place or even an abstract stage is jí 及.

sense.def: go so far as to lead to V-ing
reach (of non-human agents); go as far as; apply to; happen to
extend to, reach; reach up to the level of; reach out to; reach as far back as to the time of
be equalled, be caught up with
it gets as far as (the time N in the future)
reach out to, reach as far as
get as far as, reach as far as; get to the place N
when it comes to N, when it came to the time N
至於犬馬"when it comes to dogs and horses": (abstractly) towards
be reached (of something high) 不可極
reach as far as the contextually determinate object; get to the contextually determinate object
go as far as; reach as far as (a place)
get to the point of Nab-act-ing, reach the level of N
go as far as to V
when it comes to the time N
reach to > to (preposition. marking the resultative destination of a movement)
reaching until> as far as, to
go as far as to the extent N1 of N2
causative: cause N to reach the point of V
resultative verb modifier, cf. modern 到
reach the point of (N) 致乎哀
reach (a place, a time, or a standard/level)

entry.def: Dài 逮 refers to catching up or reaching a certain desirable stage or level of achievement. See also CATCH UP.

sense.def: reach far enough; be up to scratch
get as far as the contextually determinate point; affect
reach up to, reach the level of; become a match to
reach up to, get to the level of; match
be lived up to, be reached; be matched
catch up, overtake; come in time for
cause something determinate N1 to reach (somewhere N2)
reach the intended aim; specifically: convey the intended meaning
reach or catch up with the contextually determinate N
yì jí: continue on so as to reach> reach until
yì jí: reach upto> affect, reach so far as to affect

entry.def: Bì jí 比及 refers to reaching a point in time at which something happens.

sense.def: by the time one has reached (a point in time or a period in time)
(up/down) to N, as far as N
reach 何往而不遂 "Where does he set out for and does not arrive at"
be as much as, amount to
SHI: it comes to the time of N
lead directly to, reach all the way to
cause the contextually determinate N1 to reach/connect with N2
cause the contextually determinate N1 to reach/connect with N2
reaching one's aims, getting through with one's efforts
cause N to cut through so as to reach the aim
reach all the way to (distant places etc)
reach all the way to (distant places etc)
go all the way> be exhaustively adequate; be perfect
